title.narrative: 1.4 TUBERCULOSIS AND MALARIA SUPPORT

description.narrative: MoPH has enhanced capacity to provide equitable access to quality TB and malaria services, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: MoPH has enhanced capacity to provide equitable access to quality TB and malaria services

description.narrative: The implementation of the TB and malaria programmes supported by the Global Fund was severely impacted by COVID-19 prevention;measures, especially border closures for international staff;and technical expertise,;as well as commodities. Through close liaison with the Ministry of Public Health, pipeline supplies were well managed with shorter shelf-life commodities reallocated to other countries. ;As of September 2021, TB treatment success rate was 86.4 per cent;(2020 83.6 per cent) for new cases and 76.5 per cent;(2020 76.5 per cent) for retreatment cases, and a malaria blood examination rate of 0.35 per cent;(2020 2.87 per cent) | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:12/01/2022
